tm.name: Mean temperature
tm.description: Mean temperature is the daily average temperature, calculated from the minimum and maximum temperature in this case.

su25.name: Summer Days
su25.description: A Summer Day is a day when the daily maximum temperature is equal or higher than 25 Celsius degrees. Formula: Tmax ≥ 25°C

su30.name: Hot Days
su30.description: A Hot Day is a day when the daily maximum temperature is equal or higher than 30 Celsius degrees. Formula: Tmax ≥ 30°C

fd0.name: Frost Days
fd0.description: A Frost Day is a day when the daily minimum temperature is lower than 0 Celsius degrees. Formula: Tmin < 0°C

rr1.name: Wet Days
rr1.description: A Wet Day is a day when the daily precipitation amount reaches or exceeds 1 mm. Formula: RRsum ≥ 1mm

gdd15.name: Growing Degree Days (Base 15°C)
gdd15.description: Growing Degree Days (GDD) is a climate index that quantifies the accumulation of heat in a specific location over time, helping to predict plant growth and development. Formula: (Tmax - Tmin) / 2 - Tbase if (Tmax - Tmin) / 2 > Tbase, else 0
